snippet.textDisplay: He is the best, nearly won in his rookie season in 2007, won on the last corner in 2008 in a era where mclaren and Ferrari were equal, then he had 5 years of still winning races and pole positions, still doing great overtakes and comebacks and was always exciting to watch but result had the meat aerodynamics and ferrari had the pace, and he suffered from reliability issues lots of retirements in this period, in 2013 he joined Mercedes and beat rosberg and rosberg had consistently beat an ageing Schumacher , then in 2014 he got the best car and proved how good he is, and since then he only lost in 1 season to rosberg by 5 points but still managed to end the season with 10 wins to rosbergs 9,  I would love to see vettel and Hamilton in the same team before they retire
snippet.textOriginal: He is the best, nearly won in his rookie season in 2007, won on the last corner in 2008 in a era where mclaren and Ferrari were equal, then he had 5 years of still winning races and pole positions, still doing great overtakes and comebacks and was always exciting to watch but result had the meat aerodynamics and ferrari had the pace, and he suffered from reliability issues lots of retirements in this period, in 2013 he joined Mercedes and beat rosberg and rosberg had consistently beat an ageing Schumacher , then in 2014 he got the best car and proved how good he is, and since then he only lost in 1 season to rosberg by 5 points but still managed to end the season with 10 wins to rosbergs 9,  I would love to see vettel and Hamilton in the same team before they retire

snippet.textDisplay: I have always been a Ferrari Fan. I loved Ayrton and Michael. I did not like Lewis that much, especially when he took away the 2008 Championship from Felipe. But there is no doubt he is the best these days. It is not only his Driving/competition skills, he has evolved as a person. He is truly a true model for young people. I wish he comes to drive la Rossa. I can't wait to see Charles and Lewis fighting against each other with the same car. It would make both better and better.
snippet.textOriginal: I have always been a Ferrari Fan. I loved Ayrton and Michael. I did not like Lewis that much, especially when he took away the 2008 Championship from Felipe. But there is no doubt he is the best these days. It is not only his Driving/competition skills, he has evolved as a person. He is truly a true model for young people. I wish he comes to drive la Rossa. I can't wait to see Charles and Lewis fighting against each other with the same car. It would make both better and better.

snippet.textDisplay: Lewis is The People's Champ... a world class athlete. World class champion. As a new F1 fan, it can get boring to see him win so often. But in the right perspective, we're in the midst of being able to watch the greatest to ever do it in the pinnacle of motorsports as he caps off a career the likes of which we've never seen before and may never see again. Bravo, Lewis.... thanks for being you.

But in the right perspective, we're in the midst of being able to watch the greatest to ever do it in the pinnacle of motorsports as he caps off a career the likes of which we've never seen before and may never see again. Bravo, Lewis.... thanks for being you.

snippet.textDisplay: What a moment...
snippet.textOriginal: What a moment...

snippet.textDisplay:
I feel so proud of this man- as a fellow Brit, I truly believe he has elevated the sport and hope the visions he laid out in this video would be realised one day.
On a sad note, it is rather glaring the misconceptions that the media helps to propagate against him. Which begs the question why? I remember during his very early years how the likes of Martin Brundle would use their privileged positions and question his mental faculty and at the same time heap praises on the likes of Rosberg about their intelligence and thinking capacity.
I believed then and still do now these were the building stones for the hate that is generated towards Hamilton to this day as most of his haters would put it down to him being given a helping hand when the fact is truly the opposite.
I know most would doubt this but if they ought to go through the archives of the commentaries on these races in full and get my point.
They always used terms like aggressive and brain in such veiled way but whenever another driver displayed worst they would explain it away- most recently is the rather arrogant and frankly rude attitude of Verstappen- listen to the deafening sound of silence about his mannerisms.


I wish Hamilton and Mercedes a very successful and harmonious 2020 and may the fans be better for it...


P.S... You must finish your career in Red! :)
snippet.textOriginal:
I feel so proud of this man- as a fellow Brit, I truly believe he has elevated the sport and hope the visions he laid out in this video would be realised one day.
On a sad note, it is rather glaring the misconceptions that the media helps to propagate against him. Which begs the question why? I remember during his very early years how the likes of Martin Brundle would use their privileged positions and question his mental faculty and at the same time heap praises on the likes of Rosberg about their intelligence and thinking capacity.
I believed then and still do now these were the building stones for the hate that is generated towards Hamilton to this day as most of his haters would put it down to him being given a helping hand when the fact is truly the opposite. 
I know most would doubt this but if they ought to go through the archives of the commentaries on these races in full and get my point.
They always used terms like aggressive and brain in such veiled way but whenever another driver displayed worst they would explain it away- most recently is the rather arrogant and frankly rude attitude of Verstappen- listen to the deafening sound of silence about his mannerisms. 


I wish Hamilton and Mercedes a very successful and harmonious 2020 and may the fans be better for it...  


P.S... You must finish your career in Red! :)

snippet.textDisplay: I feel honored to experience Lewis Hamilton from the start of his Formula 1 career to present day. Most legends you hear about only but rarely experience. The amazing thing is that Formula 1 is not going to be what we remember him for the most. Formula 1 is just the current greatest example of what the special mind of Hamilton is capable. I can't wait to see what he will accomplish in his life after Formula 1 and  without the restrictions that come with it.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel honored to experience Lewis Hamilton from the start of his Formula 1 career to present day. Most legends you hear about only but rarely experience. The amazing thing is that Formula 1 is not going to be what we remember him for the most. Formula 1 is just the current greatest example of what the special mind of Hamilton is capable. I can't wait to see what he will accomplish in his life after Formula 1 and  without the restrictions that come with it.

snippet.textDisplay: This make me regret not finishing auto mechanic school.  I got a degree in something I don't really love anymore and I just wish I had finished. That was the plan to get the level two move to America get a degree in engineering work at NASCAR for a bit then find a way to Formula 1. Maybe after I get rid of some of my student loans... I think ill have another crack at it... I'll be older but hey it's still worth a shot.

snippet.textDisplay: damn this is so inspirational, I want to do a lot of things including racing, but i have never really felt at home because I've never really seen anyone to look up to, and in all the races i've ever been in (around 25), i've only seen maybe 4 PoC. But hearing Lewis speak and watching Jehan Dharuvala drive in F3 has given me hope, an I also realized the importance of having female figures in high places for all the boys and girls with dreams to look up to. cheers.
snippet.textOriginal: damn this is so inspirational, I want to do a lot of things including racing, but i have never really felt at home because I've never really seen anyone to look up to, and in all the races i've ever been in (around 25), i've only seen maybe 4 PoC. snippet.textDisplay: On Race day, I usually cheer for any other team or driver than Mercedes and Hamilton. However, I respect the technical and operational excellence of Mercedes and the absolute skill, speed and humility Hamilton brings to the grid

snippet.textDisplay:
As a kid and Ferrari fan I loved Schumacher because he win everything with Ferrari. When you, Lewis, came at Mercedes and you started win (almost) every year I hated you until now when I finally realize one thing, I see you like I saw Schumacher independently from the car you’re driving you are the best, you’re the hammer and I finally see you like always have been, one of the most successful F1 drivers of all time, and the one that will soon become the best for the successes you get and you will get.
Thanks to Mercedes and Lewis Hamilton
snippet.textOriginal:
As a kid and Ferrari fan I loved Schumacher because he win everything with Ferrari. When you, Lewis, came at Mercedes and you started win (almost) every year I hated you until now when I finally realize one thing, I see you like I saw Schumacher independently from the car you’re driving you are the best, you’re the hammer and I finally see you like always have been, one of the most successful F1 drivers of all time, and the one that will soon become the best  for the successes you get and you will get. 
Thanks to Mercedes and Lewis Hamilton
